alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 27 at 11:06AM EDT until September 27 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND NORTH CENTRAL OSWEGO COUNTIES... At 1106 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in a small area near Sandy Pond. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. While the heaviest rain has ended, excessive runoff may still result in flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sandy Pond, Sandy Creek, Ellisburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
